Name: Dreams of Cindertide
Description: Complete all Dreams of Cindertide challenges across the Wastelands
QuestDesc: Complete all Dreams of Cindertide challenges across the Wastelands

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I've just sensed a Dreamscape Node being restored in the Sanguis Plateaus. And no surprise, it was your doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You describe what happened to the Ebony Gatekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A dark sword burning in flames, with Nightmares bearing Dark Tide frequencies coming out of it when touched? Could it be...

Options.PlotLineKey: It was suppressing the Nightmare Tacet Discords.
Was it guarding the Dreamscape Node?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed... That appears to be the case. The question is,  who placed the sword there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot say for certain. It might have been placed there solely to suppress the Tacet Discords. But... by whom?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it a unique Resonator who could perceive the Dreamscapes, or could this power originate from the Somnoire itself?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When that sword disappeared, I felt a warm frequency in the wind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How extraordinary... If it's not too much trouble, could you restore the remaining nodes, {PlayerName}? I'll mark their locations for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my suspicions are correct, the answer to the sword's origin is hidden within the remaining nodes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... Many years ago, I learned a line of a poem... in a dream, from someone in Huanglong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It goes... "Their forms did fall, yet souls endure unbound. Valiant in death, as heroes they are crowned."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like you've figured out those swords?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. And it would seem I've made an error of judgment on my part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They originated from neither a Resonator nor a Somnoire... There was no need for them to be "unique." They are merely the dreams of the fallen from Septimont, who couldn't reach the Somnoire.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merely dreams?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. Dreams. No matter how much they burned, the warriors could not eliminate the Nightmares. The best they could do was trap them, biding their time until the arrival of a "hero."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that was why the frequencies that constituted those swords ultimately faded, reaching for Septimont...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were hoping to return home. The warriors of Septimont would much rather return to their homeland than find eternal peace in Dreamscapes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, yes. I've discovered something interesting within the final Node of the Sanguis Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As their long-awaited hero, you should take it.
